seisflows3.solver.specfem2d

This is the subclass seisflows.solver.specfem2d

This class provides utilities for the Seisflows solver interactions with Specfem2D. It inherits all attributes from seisflows3.solver.Base,

Module Contents

seisflows3.solver.specfem2d.preprocess
class seisflows3.solver.specfem2d.Specfem2D

Bases: custom_import('solver', 'base')

Python interface to Specfem2D. This subclass inherits functions from seisflows.solver.Base

!!! See base class for method descriptions !!!

logger
property required(self)

A hard definition of paths and parameters required by this class, alongside their necessity for the class and their string explanations.

check(self, validate=True)

Checks parameters and paths

check_solver_parameter_files(self)

Checks SPECFEM2D Par_file for acceptable parameters and matches with the internally set parameters

generate_data(self, **model_kwargs)

Generates data using the True model, exports traces to traces/obs

Parameters

model_kwargs – keyword arguments to pass to generate_mesh

initialize_adjoint_traces(self)

Setup utility: Creates the “adjoint traces” expected by SPECFEM. This is only done for the ‘base’ the Preprocess class.

Note:

Adjoint traces are initialized by writing zeros for all channels. Channels actually in use during an inversion or migration will be overwritten with nonzero values later on.

generate_mesh(self, model_path, model_name, model_type='gll')

Performs meshing with internal mesher Meshfem2D and database generation

Parameters

  • model_path (str) – path to the model to be used for mesh generation

  • model_name (str) – name of the model to be used as identification

  • model_type (str) – available model types to be passed to the Specfem3D Par_file. See Specfem3D Par_file for available options.

forward(self, path='traces/syn')

Calls SPECFEM2D forward solver, exports solver outputs to traces dir

Parameters

path (str) – path to export traces to after completion of simulation

adjoint(self)

Calls SPECFEM2D adjoint solver, creates the SEM folder with adjoint traces which is required by the adjoint solver

smooth(self, input_path, **kwargs)

Specfem2D requires additional model parameters in directory to perform the xsmooth_sem task. This function will copy these files into the directory before performing the base smooth operations.

Kwargs should match arguments of solver.base.smooth()

Note

This operation is usually run with run(single=True) so only one task will be performing these operations.

Parameters

input_path (str) – path to data

import_model(self, path)

File transfer utility to move a SPEFEM2D model into the correct location for a workflow.

Parameters

path (str) – path to the SPECFEM2D model

Returns

export_model(self, path)

File transfer utility to move a SPEFEM2D model from the DATA directory to an external path location

Parameters

path (str) – path to export the SPECFEM2D model

Returns

property data_filenames(self)

Returns the filenames of all data, either by the requested components or by all available files in the directory.

Note

If the glob returns an empty list, this function exits the workflow because filenames should not be empty is they’re being queried

Return type

list

Returns

list of data filenames

property model_databases(self)

The location of model inputs and outputs as defined by SPECFEM2D

property kernel_databases(self)

The location of kernel inputs and outputs as defined by SPECFEM2D

property data_wildcard(self, comp='?')

Returns a wildcard identifier for synthetic data based on SPECFEM2D file naming schema. Allows formatting dcomponent e.g., when called by solver.data_filenames

Parameters

comp (str) – component formatter, defaults to wildcard ‘?’

Return type

str

Returns

wildcard identifier for channels

property source_prefix(self)

Specfem2D’s preferred source prefix

Return type

str

Returns

source prefix
